t: Jeremiah 48
Prophecies against Moab

About*p Moab, this is what the Lord*s of Armies, the God of Israel, says: Woe*pn to Nebo, because it is about to be destroyed; Kiriathaim*ln will be put to shame; it will be taken captive. The*ln fortress will be put to shame and dismayed!
There*ln is no longer praise for Moab; they*ln plan harm against her in Heshbon: Come,*ln let’s cut her off from nationhood. Also,*ln Madmen, you will be silenced; the*ln sword will follow you.
A*ln voice cries out from Horonaim, “devastation*ln and a crushing blow!”
Moab*ln will be shattered; her*ln little ones will cry out.
For*ln on the Ascent to Luhith they*ln will be weeping continually, and*ln on the descent to Horonaim will*ln be heard cries of distress over the destruction:
Flee!*ln Save your lives! Be*ln like a juniper bush in the wilderness.
Because*ln you trust in your works and treasures, you*ln will be captured also. Chemosh*ln will go into exile with*ln his priests and officials.
The*ln destroyer will move against every town; not*ln one town will escape. The*ln valley will perish, and*ln the plain will be annihilated, as*ln the Lord*s has said.
Make*ln Moab a salt marsh, for*ln she will run away; her*ln towns will become a desolation, without*ln inhabitant.
The*ln one who does the*ln Lord’s*s business deceitfully is cursed, and*ln the one who withholds his*ln sword from bloodshed is cursed.

Moab*ln has been left quiet since his youth, settled*ln like wine on its dregs. He*ln hasn’t been poured from one container to another or*ln gone into exile. So*ln his taste has remained the same, and*ln his aroma hasn’t changed.
Therefore*ln look, the days are coming— this*lg is the Lord’s*s declaration — when*pn I will send pourers to him, who will pour him out. They*ln will empty his containers and*ln smash his jars.
Moab*ln will be put to shame because of Chemosh, just*ln as the house of Israel was put to shame because*ln of Bethel that they trusted in.
How*ln can you say, “We are warriors — valiant*ln men for battle”?
The*ln destroyer of Moab and its towns has*ln come up, and*ln the best of its young men have*ln gone down to slaughter. This*lg is the King’s declaration; the*lg Lord*s of Armies is his name.
Moab’s*pn calamity is near at hand; his*ln disaster is rushing swiftly.
Mourn*ln for him, all you surrounding nations, everyone*ln who knows his name. Say,*ln “How the mighty scepter is shattered, the*ln glorious staff!”
Come*ln down from glory; sit on parched ground, resident*ln of the daughter of Dibon, for*ln the destroyer of Moab has come against you; he*ln has destroyed your fortresses.
Stand*ln by the highway and watch, resident*ln of Aroer! Ask*ln him who is fleeing or her who is escaping, “What*ln happened?”
Moab*ln is put to shame, indeed dismayed. Wail*ln and cry out! Declare*ln by the Arnon that*ln Moab is destroyed.
“Judgment*p has come to the land of the plateau- to Holon, Jahzah, Mephaath,
Dibon, Nebo, Beth-diblathaim,
Kiriathaim, Beth-gamul, Beth-meon,
Kerioth, Bozrah, and all the towns of the land of Moab, those far and near.
Moab’s horn is chopped off; his arm is shattered.” This*lg is the Lord’s*s declaration.
“Make*p him drunk, because he has exalted himself against the Lord.*s Moab will wallow in his own vomit, and he will also become a laughingstock.
Wasn’t Israel a laughingstock to you? Was he ever found among thieves? For whenever you speak of him you shake your head.”
Abandon*pn the towns! Live in the cliffs, residents*ln of Moab! Be*ln like a dove that*ln nests inside the mouth of a cave.
We*pn have heard of Moab’s pride, great*ln pride, indeed — his*ln insolence, arrogance, pride, and*ln haughty heart.
I*ln know his outburst. This*lg is the Lord’s*s declaration. It*pn is empty. His*ln boast is empty.
Therefore,*ln I will wail over Moab. I*ln will cry out for Moab, all of it; he*ln will moan for the men of Kir-heres.

I*ln will weep for you, vine of Sibmah, with*ln more than the weeping for Jazer. Your*ln tendrils have extended to the sea; they*ln have reached to the sea and to Jazer. The*ln destroyer has fallen on your summer fruit and grape harvest.

Gladness*ln and celebration are taken from the fertile field and*ln from the land of Moab. I*ln have stopped the flow of wine from the winepresses; no*ln one will tread with shouts of joy. The*ln shouting is not a shout of joy.
“There*p is a cry from Heshbon to Elealeh; they make their voices heard as far as Jahaz- from Zoar to Horonaim and Eglath-shelishiyah - because even the Waters of Nimrim have become desolate.
In Moab, I will stop” - this is the Lord’s*s declaration - “the one who offers sacrifices on the high place and burns incense to his gods.
Therefore, my heart moans like flutes for Moab, and my heart moans like flutes for the people of Kir-heres. And therefore, the wealth he has gained has perished.
Indeed, every head is bald and every beard is chopped short. On every hand is a gash and sackcloth around the waist.
On all the rooftops of Moab and in her public squares, everyone is mourning because I have shattered Moab like a jar no one wants.” This is the Lord’s*s declaration.
“How broken it is! They wail! How Moab has turned his back! He is ashamed. Moab will become a laughingstock and a shock to all those around him.”
For*p this is what the Lord*s says: Look!*pn He will swoop down like an eagle and*ln spread his wings against Moab.
The*ln towns have been captured, and*ln the strongholds seized. In*ln that day the heart of Moab’s warriors will*ln be like the heart of a woman with contractions.
Moab*ln will be destroyed as a people because*ln he has exalted himself against the Lord.*s
Panic,*ln pit, and trap await*ln you, resident of Moab. This*lg is the Lord’s*s declaration.

He*pn who flees from the panic will fall in the pit, and*ln he who climbs from the pit will*ln be captured in the trap, for*ln I will bring against Moab the*ln year of their punishment. This*lg is the Lord’s*s declaration.

Those*pn who flee will stand exhausted in Heshbon’s shadow because*ln fire has come out from Heshbon and*ln a flame from within Sihon. It*ln will devour Moab’s forehead and*ln the skull of the noisemakers.
Woe*ln to you, Moab! The*ln people of Chemosh have perished because*ln your sons have been taken captive and*ln your daughters have gone into captivity.
Yet,*ln I will restore the fortunes of Moab in the last days. This*lg is the Lord’s*s declaration. The*pn judgment on Moab ends here.
